::Prowl::

Prowl's comm-link barely picks up the message, playing it back four 
times before Prowl can distinguish the words. As soon as he can, he 
transfers the message to Iron Raptor over thought.

-I'm going to go get these bots here to base, love,- he thinks to 
her, -I'll be back in a flash.-

Jumping up into the air, Prowl powers his boosters, flying toward 
Turkey, his speed climbing rapidly toward 400mph.



--- In nbwrpg@y..., Jeremiah <rdahl@s...> wrote:
> In outer space, everything naturally happens at once. Stars shed 
immense
> amount of energy,  the planets constantly rotate on an axis, and a 
worm
> hole opens up. But upon closer inspection, the worm hole is neither
> natural, or peaceful like its surrounding. A very small interstellar
> shuttle emerges from the worm hole, with laser fire on its tail. The
> thrusters are burning more than they normally should, for they are 
damaged,
> and the ship starts to careen out of control, towards the third 
planet from
> the power eminating star.
> 
> Inside the shuttle three robots run around, but it is to dark to 
make out
> their appearance, the only light, comes from small fires bursting up
> everywhere. One of the larger ones stops at a fire, and aims both 
hands at
> it. A swhirl of blue energy builds up, then shoots a beam of liquid
> nitrogen at the fire putting it out. Another, very small robot gets 
into
> the control chair, and attempts to steer the ship, "No good, its 
out of
> control" he says. Then the third robot runs over to a consol, "Hey, 
dont
> worry guys, i'll send a distress signal, just close the transwarp 
portal,
> before our friends follow us".  At the calm words of the blue robot 
at the
> consol, the one in the control chair flips a button.
> 
> Outside, the worm hole closes up, and all is as it should have 
been, except
> for the small ship, starting to burn as it enters the atmosphere.
> 
> Over an old Autobot frequency, and emergency signal 
begins, "emergency, our
> ship is out of control, we will require assistance, and more than 
likely,
> repairs when we crash" and this message plays over loops, as the 
ship
> descends towards Turkey, making a flaming path through the 
atmosphere on
> its descent.
